edu.stanford.math.plex4.utility

Class FormalSumUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.math.plex4.utility.FormalSumUtility

  • public class FormalSumUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains various utility functions for interacting with formal sums (chains).
    Author:
    Andrew Tausz

      static int[][] extractVertices(java.util.List<Simplex> simplices)

      • extractActiveBasisElements

        public static <F,U> java.util.List<U> extractActiveBasisElements(edu.stanford.math.primitivelib.autogen.formal_sum.ObjectSparseFormalSum<F,U> chain)
        This function returns all of the basis elements in a chain which have non-zero coefficients. The primary use case will be to extract the set of simplicies in a chain.
        Parameters:
        chain -
        Returns:
        the set of active basis elements in a formal sum
